page.title: 09FARMING.CALCOT,READING
page.content: The Calcot area up until the end of the 2nd World War was used largely for farming.Since that time increasing amounts of land have been bought and built upon. The main type of farming was arable and dairy.In the 1960's one herd contained over 100 cows.Now all that is gone.Some fields in the North East of the Calcot area are still used to grow cereal crops but this may not continue for long,since housing development is planned in that area. Some fields are used for grazing horses,but these are fields which would otherwise remain fallow. As Calcot grows,and all the open space gets built upon,it will eventually become a suburb of Reading. At that time its past association with farming will be broken.
